gui module¶

Graphical-User Interface module.

For simple Address Book applet - Project 1 - CIS 422, W‘14, University of Oregon

author:Sarah Yablok <sarahy@cs.uoregon.edu>
class gui.GUI(parent)¶

Bases: Tkinter.Frame

Main class which represents our parent window for the GUI.

addEntry(top)¶

Get all of the fields entered by the user in the toplevel window Add the new contact object to the address book and update the canvas.

addressbook = None¶

for i in range (0, 5): new_contact = Contact() setattr(new_contact, ‘lname’, “Yablok” + str(i)) self.addressbook.add(new_contact)

boxClicked(event)¶

Give the rectangle the ‘select’ tag when clicked, and the highlight properties (outline and white background.

clickAdd()¶

Add an entry to the address book. Creates a new top level window with inputs, and refers to the addEntry function to add the new contact object.

clickDelete()¶

Delete a contact from the address book, prompt a confirmation box which reviews the contact information, and proceeds to delete the entry from the addressbook, and update the Canvas

clickEdit()¶

Edit an existing entry in the address book. Creates a new top level window with inputs which automatically gets the existing fields from the contact selected by the user. It refers to the editEntry() function to make the edits in to the actual contact in the addressbook.

clickSearch()¶

General search for all of the fields and all of the contacts in the address book. It will look for exact matches in fields. For example search will accurately find ‘123 Easy St’ but not just ‘Easy St’. (Needs full search field.

close()¶

Close an address book and prompt the user to save changes. If no address book is open, quit the program

editEntry(top)¶

Edit the entry id in self.tempID. Update all of the fields, and update the Canvas to reflect these changes.

export()¶

Export the current address book to a .tsv file. Prompt the user to select a file, update the Canvas with the imported addressbook

fill_book(subset)¶

Fill the Canvas with the info from adresses from the subset provided. for each entry add a rectangle to the canvas, and the associated address text within the rectangle. Bind these boxes to the boxClicked() function.

get_tagged_box(tag)¶

Search through Canvas objects by tags, return the rectangle with the given tag.

hover(event)¶

Binding for when the user hovers over a rectangle. Changes the cursor.

imp()¶

Import a new address from a .tsv file. Prompt the user to select a file, update the Canvas with the imported addressbook

initUI()¶

Setup the window and display it.

mailLabels()¶

View the contact information in a mailing label format. Update the canvas to display new format

new()¶

Create a new blank address book, ask to save before creating new book. Update the Canvas with the new book.

noMailLabels()¶

View the contact information in the regular format. Update the canvas to display new format

no_hover(event)¶

Binding for when the user stops hovering over a rectangle. Changes the cursor.

open()¶

Open a new address book and prompt the user to save changes.

quit()¶

Quit the program but make sure to save changes first.

save()¶

Save an address book to the disk.

save_as()¶

Save an address book to the disk prompting for a file name.

sort(att)¶

Sort the addresses by last name. This search function only works on the full addressbook, not a subset, sort before searching.

update()¶

Update the canvas once a change has been made to the addressbook, to display changes in the addressbook we delete all entries and and re-fill the canvas via the fill_book() function.

updateSearchState()¶

Special update function which uses a subset of the full address book - the self.searchState which is the current search results.

gui.combine_funcs(*funcs)¶

Simple function which takes two function commands, and combines their actions, one after another. (Used for closing toplevel window after adding or editing a contact.

gui.main()¶

Create the GUI class with the root window. Configure the menu bars.
